185921057.review:
[h1]The [i]little sister[/i] of narrative FPS[/h1]
[i]I chose something different. I chose the impossible. I chose...[b]Rapture[/b].[/i]

These ominous words fade away, towering submerged skyscrapers drifting into view from the deep. Their exteriors, once a facąde of extravagance now weathered from the weight of madness within and the thousands of tons of water all about them. Panicked voices flicker over the airwaves, and a feeling of foreboding sinks in as to what may lie in store within this sunken metropolis.

The cold open to [i]Bioshock[/i] is incredible, posing more questions than answers. You are plunged in the deep end (both physically and literally), into [i]Rapture[/i], an underwater society built for the hyper-elite, whose inhabitants have been perhaps indulging a little [i]too[/i] much on designer drugs.

Now, before I go any further:

[i][b]I'M PLAYING THIS GAME IN 2025[/b][/i]

My outlook is going to be predicated upon expectations set by playing successive works by other publishers. Having played [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/282140/SOMA/]SOMA[/url] recently, the bar was already set pretty high for games set in underwater cities, heck, even narrative games in general. Inherently, this isn't necessarily a bad thing. Even Bioshock sits atop the shoulders of giants, being the 'little sister' of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/410710/System_Shock_Enhanced_Edition/]System Shock[/url] (hence the casual nod in the game's title - Bio[i]SHOCK[/i]). 

That being said, Bioshock doesn’t just hold up, it excels in many aspects.

Apart from being Jeff Bezos's wet dream (no pun intended) Rapture's anachronistic art direction is impeccable, harkening back to the class and futurism of the art deco architectural movement of the 1930s. Everything about the world sparks the imagination of the player, further supported by the plethora of audio tapes that scatter the city's sprawling corridors and passageways.

Moreover, the story goes to some interesting places, though feels a little contrived at points, [spoiler]What was even the justification for the Little Sisters/Big Daddies? Is everything written off in the story as a biproduct of Adam-induced madness? The existence of Big Daddies as enemies seems shoehorned in.[/spoiler] it remains engaging and satisfying for the most part.

[i][b]That all being said...[/b][/i]
Bioshock's gameplay can be a bit of a chore in places. 
[list]
[*]The 'hacking' minigame is not much fun, and there are so many times you need to complete it considering the wide array of hackable machines, the gimmick very quicks grows tiresome.

[*]Enemies quickly become bullet-sponges, and on account of limited ammunition to pick up, the use of guns becomes quickly unviable. This leads to more hacking minigames and delegating the job of fighting to hacked security drones (which I suppose quite neatly fits with the capitalist theming of the game).

[*]The characters feel a little one-note and writing veers close to being expository in places.

[*]A number of the plasmids feel functionally similar or have limited utility.
[/list]
While some aspects may be dated, Bioshock still creates an impeccable atmosphere and builds a world quite unlike any other seen before or after it. If you haven't played Bioshock, it deserves a play for these elements alone, even if the gameplay can feel occasionally dated.

7/10

185383930.review: This is an excellent game and one of the best games ever released for consoles like the PlayStation 3, but I can't recommend playing this version of the game seeing as I and many other people have had issues playing it. I also can't save seeing as the game thinks that it was installed on the wrong hard drive and that there's no space available. Neither of those things are true. I would just play the remastered version if I were you. If anybody knows how to fix these issues, please let me know.

[h1]品尝经典[/h1]
[b]+[/b]
十年前的游戏，很整，各个部分从现在的眼光来看可能不是那么的好[spoiler]主要是画面部分[/spoiler]，但他们都恰如其分的为沉浸式游戏体验服务，剧情，技能，地图设计，美风都很整，刚刚好

[b]-[/b]画面闪光太多，画面资产和声音资产同时出现过多有时会出现bug，消失不了重复出现，掉san

185083717.review:
I've beaten this game countless times, yet it remains captivating. The story is compelling, the combat is engaging, and it feels genuinely crafted, not rushed for profit. This game is for players who want to experience something special. You will enjoy it. I began playing at nine and will continue playing it at fifty. I plan to share it with my children.

Bioshock plunges you into the underwater city of Rapture, a haven for the brightest minds and boldest spirits, built on the promise of freedom and self-reliance. But as you explore this decaying utopia, you uncover a dark truth: the pursuit of power can corrupt even the noblest of intentions.

You'll play as a plane crash survivor who stumbles upon this hidden world full of secrets, danger, and a unique kind of philosophical intrigue. As you delve deeper into Rapture's mysteries, you'll confront the words of Andrew Ryan, the city's enigmatic founder: [u] “In the end, what separates a man from a slave? Money? Power? No, a man chooses; a slave obeys.”[/u] This game will stay with you long after you finish it, challenging you to think about the nature of freedom, the price of progress, and the choices we make in the face of adversity.

184845192.review:
Infelizmente só fui conhecer o jogo 15 anos após seu lançamento, mas mesmo assim, não deixei faltar nada na experiência. Para um jogo que mergulha em uma narrativa profunda picotada em vários pontos durante a gameplay, me cativou do início ao fim. Os cenários são únicos e muito bonitos. O contraste de posteres e neons coloridos com o ambiente sombrio, mais a direção de arte inspirada no steampunk e na arte decco são muito bem feitos. O combate foi a única coisa que achei repetitivo, mas sei que o foco de Bioshock sempre foi a história mesmo.

<< NOTA: 8/10 >>

(NO SPOILERS)
I went blindly on this one and I WAS NOT expeting such a great, fun and a story game.

At first I was mostly confused and lost since I never had any touch with the franchise before, but now? I'm a cetified enjoyer. I love the game's visuals, infact, it might actually be one of my favorite ones I've ever seen for a loooong while. 184043259.review:
It's the original Bioshock, what more do you expect?

It's a classic masterpiece. Combat feels great, with your weapons and super powers. 
Enemies are pretty cool, like the infamous Big Daddies. And the mechanics are also nice, like the looting system and how you unlock and use powers.
The graphics aren't anything super special and the blood looks really weird. But those are irrelevant details. I'd even say that they add to the visual style of the game, so they're not a negative thing.

However, the 2 main highlights of this game are the game's location and story. 
Rapture is one of the best and most interesting locations in all of gaming. The dark underwater setting and environment is beautiful in its own way, but also pretty dark and unique. It's a really cool atmosphere that matches the dark themes of the game very well.
And the story is also one of the best ones in gaming too. Definitly the best one in the triology. As you progress, you discover how Rapture came to be and what horrible things happened in it. And you find more about your own character later on. It also has one of the sickest plot twists ever. Everyone knows what it is at this point, but I won't spoil it anyways!

A great start to a great triology, play this game for sure if you like story driven singleplayer first person shooters.

Отличная игра, первая в культовой серии. Восторг - утопический город самых смелых идей, а по итогу превратился в ужасное место, где слабые погибают, а сильные вынуждены постоянно бороться за свои жизни. 
И хоть игра вышла в 2007 году, но геймплей всё ещё ощущается бодро, а стилистика игры приковывает к себе внимание  до сих пор.
